page.title: 03FARMING ON THE MENDIPS
page.content: {Dairy Farming:}Dairy Farming is the main occupation on the Mendips. In winter, farmers feed their cattle on silage and hay. In summer the remainder of the fields are used in rotation for grazing. The most common breed of cow is the Friesian. {Clothier's Farms:}Clothier's Farms in this area total approximately 2000 acres, half of which is arable. Clothier's own Home Farm in Ston Easton and Franklyn Farm in Chewton Mendip. They milk 260 cows, lamb 700 ewes, and keep 4500 pigs. {Arable Farming:}About 10% of farming in this part of the Mendips is arable farming. The cereals consist largely of wheat, oats, barley, maize, oil seed rape and sugar beet.
